metadata.titleEn: WATER: Dataset of ground truth measurements synchronizing with Terra MISR and MODIS in the Binggou watershed foci experimental area on Dec. 10 and Dec. 11, 2007 during the pre-observation period
metadata.description:
The dataset of ground truth measurements synchronizing with Terra MISR and MODIS was obtained in sampling plot BG-A of the Binggou watershed foci experimental area on Dec. 10 and Dec. 11, 2007 during the pre-observation period.
     Observation items included:
     (1) Snow parameters including the snow surface temperature, the snow-soil interface temperature, the land surface temperature by the handheld infrared thermometer, the snow layer temperature by the probe thermometer, snow depth by the ruler and the snow grain size by the handheld microscope.
     (2)  Snow density in "WATER: Dataset of snow density measurements in the Binggou watershed foci experimental area on Dec. 6 and Dec. 10, 2007 during the pre-observation period"
     (3)  Snow properties in "WATER: Dataset of snow properties measured by the Snowfork in the Binggou watershed foci experimental area during the pre-observation period"
     Raw data and pre-processed data including snow parameters synchronizing with Terra MISR and MODIS and the temperature synchronizing with MODIS were archived herein.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to observe snow parameters synchronously with satellite data in a dense observation area?
Example.Answer: An example of a data collection method in this field is conducting ground-based synchronous observations of snow parameters and surface temperature in a dense observation area. This involves measuring snow surface and snow-soil interface temperatures using handheld infrared thermometers, snow layer temperatures with needle thermometers, snow depth with rulers, and snow grain size with handheld microscopes. These measurements are synchronized with satellite observations from Terra MISR and MODIS to provide datasets for remote sensing inversion verification.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the data collection methods used for observing snow parameters and surface temperature in remote sensing validation experiments?
Feature Specification.Answer: snow surface temperature, snow-soil interface temperature, surface temperature, snow layer temperature, snow depth, snow grain size, snow density

Definition.Question: What does 'synchronous observation' mean in the context of Terra MISR and MODIS data collection?
Definition.Answer: In the context of Terra MISR and MODIS data collection, 'synchronous observation' refers to the method of collecting data at the same time as satellite overpasses, ensuring the ground-based measurements of parameters such as snow surface temperature, snow-soil interface temperature, surface temperature, and snow density are aligned with the satellite data. This approach is essential for validating remote sensing retrievals and enhancing the accuracy of satellite data interpretation.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to conduct synchronized snow parameter and surface temperature observations using Terra MISR and MODIS in the context of remote sensing retrieval validation?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The objective of conducting synchronized snow parameter and surface temperature observations using Terra MISR and MODIS is to provide a dataset for the validation of remote sensing retrievals. This involves measuring snow surface and interface temperatures, surface temperature, snow stratification temperature, snow depth, and snow grain size, which are crucial for accurate remote sensing data interpretation and validation.
